org.xflatdb.xflat.query

Interface IntervalProvider<T>


  • public interface IntervalProvider<T>
    Interval Providers are used to determine intervals for sharding. An interval provider determines an unlimited set of fixed-width intervals, each of which is mapped to a "bucket" into which data that fits into that interval is stored.

    IntervalProvider implementations ought to be able to handle any value that is expected to be selected by a sharding selector.

    Author:
    Gordon

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Comparator<T> getComparator()
      Returns a comparator that can compare the values provided by this interval.

    • Method Detail

      • getInterval

        Interval<T> getInterval(T value)
        Gets the interval that contains the given value. This interval will be used to determine the bucket into which the data associated to the value is stored.
        Parameters:
        value - The value for which a interval is needed.
        Returns:
        The interval for that value.

      • nextInterval

        Interval<T> nextInterval(Interval<T> currentInterval,
                       long factor)
        Gets another interval, which is a number of standard intervals away from the given interval.

        For instance, on an integer interval provider, if the current interval is [0, 10) and the factor is 1, the nextRange is [10, 20).
        If the factor is -2, the nextRange is [-20, -10).

        Parameters:
        currentInterval - The base interval
        factor - The number of ranges to skip.
        Returns:
        A new interval that is factor ranges away from currentRange.

      • getComparator

        Comparator<T> getComparator()
        Returns a comparator that can compare the values provided by this interval.
        Returns:
        An instance of Comparator that compares this interval's values.

      • getName

        String getName(Interval<T> interval)
        Gets a unique name for this interval. This name should be unique within the intervals provided by this IntervalProvider. This will be used by sharded engines to name shard files, and so cannot contain any illegal file path characters.
        Parameters:
        interval - The interval for which a unique name is needed.
        Returns:
        The unique name of the interval, not containing any illegal file characters.

      • getInterval

        Interval<T> getInterval(String name)
        Gets an interval from the interval's unique name. Since the name is unique it should reliably map to an interval. If the name is unparseable or cannot be mapped to an interval, null should be returned instead of throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        name - The interval's unique name, generated by getName(org.xflatdb.xflat.query.Interval)
        Returns:
        The interval for the given unique name.
